geeklist.title: Brisbane (Australia) March 2016 maths trade
geeklist.description:
This maths trade is a local swap for Brisbane, Australia. To participate you need to either be in Brisbane, or have a way to get your games to and from Brisbane for the trade.
Organiser: Sly Gryphon (with help from Friendless and thepackrat)
[u]Here are the rules:[/u]
0. Everyone should work together to make this trade work out for everyone getting their games in good order. Be up front about delays. Overcommunicate. Try to help other folks out. Seek help if you hit trouble.
[BGCOLOR=#FFFF00][b]Trade location - Mitchelton Gamers (first Sunday each month at Mitchelton library)[/b][/BGCOLOR]
1. Official trade window will be 12:00 - 14:00 on Sunday, 06 March, 2016 at the Mitchelton Gamers meetup: Mitchelton Library, 37 Heliopolis Parade, Mitchelton, Brisbane (north side). If you haven't been to Mitchelton Gamers before, you are also welcome to play before, during, or after the trade; game group runs 10:00 - 17:00.
More details about Mitchelton Gamers are in the forum: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/1477285/mitchelton-gamers-monthly-meeting-dates
There is also a Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/MitcheltonGamers/ and the Facebook event for the Maths Trade Meetup is https://www.facebook.com/events/539163562923786/ -- although the trade windows is 12:00 - 14:00, the games day runs from 10:00 - 17:00, so you can also play games while you are there (maybe get an intro / how to play from the person giving you the game).
1. a) You are welcome to handover prior to this, at one of the other gaming clubs if you arrange it yourself, but you must be able to make the games available at the trade if necessary. 1. b) If you won't be able to make it to the trade, there will probably be people coming from the various groups, so may be able to arrange yourself for someone to drop off / pick up your games.
2. If you are outside Brisbane, you are welcome to participate, provided you can get games to/from the trade. 2. a) Alternatively, you could arrange the relevant shipping for anything you send or receive, or possibly both, outside Brisbane.
[b]General rules:[/b]
3. This trade is for board games, expansions, card games, game accessories, RPG, and the like. Please don't add anything else.
4. Provide as much details as possible (edition, language, sleeved cards, game condition, etc). Pick a picture that represents the game you're offering if there are multiple versions or publishers. If necessary, take a picture of the game, upload it to your gallery, and use that image.
Note whether the game is: never opened (still in shrink wrap), open but unpunched, open and punched (but never played), open and played, or other condition.
Count all the pieces and make sure they are there. Indicate if you are combining any items, e.g expansions, organisers, or other accessories.
5. Duplicate items are fine; there is no limit on how many items you can add. You can also combine items (e.g. expansions) if you want to sell as a lot.
6. Cash offers and swaps are fine, although the preference is to swap games. Anyone receiving cash is required to give 3% to BGG via a fake marketplace listing.
You don't need to put a price in the Geek List, as it will be handled by the want lists. Note that cash can still participate in a swap chain so can be added to a want list even if there isn't a price listed, e.g. one person offering $40 for Game A can match with someone else accepting $40 for Game B (if there is a swap of Game A through to Game B).
7. Comments are great. Feel free. There's also a discussion thread.
There is also a want list verifier that I am going to try and get set up for people to use to ensure they are not malformed.
[b][u]Important Dates (times in Brisbane local):-[/u][/b]
* [-]All items added to list: [b]23:00, Wednesday 17 February, 2016[/b][/-] [b][COLOR=#FF0000]List now closed for new items.[/COLOR][/b]
* [-]Item want list codes will be posted: [b]Thursday 18 February, 2016[/b][/-] DONE
* Wants lists due by geekmail to sgryphon: [b]21:00, Wednesday 24 February, 2016[/b]
* Results posted: [b]Late Wednesday 24 February, 2016[/b] - This should give some time to pre-organise items at other game groups
* Trade window: [b]12:00 - 14:00 on Sunday 06 March, 2016[/b] - At Mitchelton Library, 37 Heliopolis Parade, Mitchelton
Discussion thread is here: [url=https://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/21653369#21653369]Brisbane March 2016 maths trade discussion thread.[/url]
Results here: TBA
Post leftovers here: TBA
Wiki link for documentation, tools and templates at the end: [url=https://www.boardgamegeek.com/wiki/page/Aussie%20Maths%20Trade]Aussie Maths Trade[/url] (some documentation may be out of date)

All cards are present, but there are 11 with minor to moderate damage (looks like a dog may have got at them or something - I am not sure, it came to me in this condition). Blank cards are included, so you could easily replace the damaged ones if you so desire.

Game itself is as new, complete and unpunched, however the box has a bit of damage. Basically it wasn't packaged particularly well in shipping to me and looks like it's been dragged along concrete on two of the corners (to the point that there's about a 3mm diameter hole on one corner). The Kickstarter creator generously replaced my damaged box with a whole new game, hence why I have an extra copy.

Fantasy Flight 2nd edition (with the larger square box as pictured). Came to me second hand in very good condition and I've never played it, so it's still in that condition.
Edit: My husband had just reminded me this is missing one of the flood tokens (to mark flooded rooms - there are nine instead of ten). This is easily substituted or possibly even not needed in most games (there are only 10 rooms which can be on fire or flooded and no room can be both at once). We've double-checked and all other components are accounted for.
Played twice, as new condition.

Recieved in maths trade and unplayed by me. When I checked the contents were complete, one of the sets of cards had a dead rubber band on them, so some cards have bits of dried rubber on them. The cards are plastic so I scraped most of it off, but there is still some here and there. Worst affected is the manual, the first page is damaged from dried rubber band.
Also the bullet has some dents and is missing its base (I never had the base, this is according to the last owner).

I got this second hand. I believe it's only been played a few times. All cards sleeved. Excellent condition (although the cards are slightly bent due to the publisher storage solution of standing them upright). (Like this: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1381908/smash)

There's one small nick out of one edge of the outer box, otherwise in perfect condition.

First Edition from Cryptozoic, as pictured.
Opened and played. The box shows some wear and one corner of the cover is torn; however, the components are in excellent condition. All cards are sleeved.
Trade or $30.

A Karaoke party game!
Excellent condition. The box has been opened, but the components are still unpunched/shrinkwrapped.
NOTE: This is the German version. The rules and board and player aids are in German. However, the cards which give you the categories for the song - the most important part of the game - are in four languages, including English. There is a video (in English) on BGG that covers how to play.
Trade or $20.

OK, this is kind of strange one, in that this copy is partially played...
My group played six games with this copy before entropy set in and we never seemed able to get back to it. Consequently, the board is partially marked- and stickered-up from the modifications we made as the results of our games. (My favourite perversity: One of the options when you win a game is to name one of the originally unnamed continents. When I got the opportunity to do that, I named the southeast continent - where Australia is on the normal Risk board - "North America"!)
We've opened 3 of the 4 envelopes and 1 of the 2 sealed tray compartments, and modified the game accordingly.
One of the ways for other people to play this set would be to have a selection process before each play where each of the personalities of the world is selected by the players. That is, someone would choose to get all the on-board/historical bonuses of "Kevin", for instance. OR You could just assume that you're coming to this world after the previous series of tribes fought and changed it and eventually killed themselves, and then you take up the new changes. OR Maybe you're just interested in the plastic bits of the six armies.
Anyway, as this is certainly a (partially) used copy, I'll be looking to get less for it...
Trade or $15.

item.objectname: Race for the Galaxy: Alien Artifacts
item.body:
Opened and played a few times. Still in excellent condition.
Trade or $20.

Two-player tactical card/board game of battling Aztec warriors. Multiple levels of play (with the Advanced Game and all options providing the best gamer experience).
Opened and played once. Excellent condition.
Trade or $10.

This is a streamlined card version of Reiner Knizia's auction game, Modern Art. This is the "classic art" version.
I do not have the box for this game. The components are stored in a plastic bag. The game has been played several times.
Trade or $5.

This is for four Starter Decks of The Pergamum Prophecy expansion. Two are Hero decks and two are Villain decks, allowing you to play with up to four players.
One Hero deck is still shrinkwrapped; the other three were opened and played with once.
Trade or $5.

This is the Kickstarter Edition with the special Mimic Box (as pictured) AND [thing=139583]Dungeon Roll: Hero Booster Pack #1 [/thing]AND [thing=139582]Dungeon Roll Hero: Guild Leader[/thing] AND more dice!
PLUS An Artscow-Printed Glasses Cloth With The Dungeon Map/Board (similar to the one in the picture)!
Excellent condition; lightly played a few times.
Trade or $25.

Shrinkwrapped, brand new.
Trade or $15.

Excellent, like-new conmdition.
Four dice that determine the start player via amusing conditions (most games, smallest shoes, etc.).
Trade or $15.

AGRICOLAPOCALYPSE!!! (The Mega-Collection!)
This is for tons (or, at least, a few kilos) of Agricola stuff!
The original game, in excellent condition. The original wooden pieces (cubes of wood) are not in the game, because everything has been replaced with animeeples, vegimeeples, farmer family meeples and the like!
I have the Lookout special pieces, the Mayfair special pieces, the MeepleSource special pieces and a few more. Basically, if I saw it available, I bought it! These special pieces are brilliantly stored and organised in a multi-compartment plastic box for easy carrying and access during the game.
I have the Z Deck. I have the X Deck. I have the 2011 World Championship Decks. I have the O-umlaut Deck (still in shrink). I have cards L00 through L08 of the L-Deck (some with multiple copies). I have a second copy of the Z Deck (still in shrink). I have the Agricola Euchre Deck.
I have the Through The Seasons postcard.
I have the new Player Boards (Mars, Desert, Snow, etc.).
Trade or $150!

This item also includes: [thing=13530][/thing] [ImageID=275839] which is both an expansion and a stand-alone game (different pizza combinations lead to different play). The two games can be combined to play Mamma Mia Grande, which is excellent.
Before Uwe Rosenberg designed Agricola and went down the "heavy" game path, he was a genius of designing innovative and wonderful card games. This is one of my favourites of his designs. Players are making pizzas with interesting twists of memory and hand management.
Both games have been played several times, but are still quite playable. The Mamma Mia! box has a small tear, but still functions fine.
Trade or $20

This is the ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING Collection!
It includes: The Base Game (opened and played a few times; still in great condition) + Expansion Pack 1: [thing=31420][/thing] (opened, but unpunched!) + Expansion Pack 2: [thing=35522][/thing] (shrinkwrapped/new) + Expansion Pack 3: [thing=35595][/thing] (shrinkwrapped/new) + Expansion 4 & Battle Box: [thing=33091][/thing] (opened, but unpunched!) + [thing=79033][/thing] (shrinkwrapped/new) + [thing=65052][/thing] (included in the Base Game box)
All original boxes are included.
When Expansion 4 (Fresh Meat) was originally produced, they messed up the insert and it did not properly hold all of the components. I have obtained the corrected insert, and that is what you will be getting inside the "Battle Box".
The "Battle Box" was designed to hold everything for the game (Base plus all expansion components).
The Adventure Modules give you a "choose your path" way to run a series of games as a campaign!
Great, fun, awesome game!
Trade or $150.
